author: thomas
title: Japanese weather sites hit by cyberattack
text:
- 14 Mar 2002
- 17,637
- 12,629
The Japan Weather Association (JMA) has been struggling with a cyberattack that has been ongoing since Thursday morning. Their website,
I use Tenki.jp regularly. Sadly, the app still takes over a minute to open.
[tenki.jp](https://jref.com/dir/tenki-jp.6617/), is currently inaccessible due to a DDoS attack, which bombards a website with so much traffic that it can't function properly. This is just the latest in a series of cyberattacks targeting Japanese companies. Airlines, mobile carriers, and banks have all been hit recently. The JMA hasn't said when the website will be back online, and they also experienced a similar attack last Sunday. They apologized for the inconvenience, especially considering the current risk of heavy snowfall.I use Tenki.jp regularly. Sadly, the app still takes over a minute to open.
[
46 Japanese entities hit by cyberattacks since year-end - The Mainichi
](https://mainichi.jp/english/articles/20250109/p2g/00m/0bu/023000c)
TOKYO (Kyodo) -- At least 46 entities in Japan, including banks and government agencies, have been targeted by cyberattacks likely utilizing the same
mainichi.jp
[
天気予報サイト「tenki.jp」にサイバー攻撃 夕方ごろ復旧 | NHK
](https://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20250109/k10014688931000.html)
【NHK】日本気象協会は、運営する天気予報サイト「tenki.jp」が9日朝から閲覧しづらい状態になっていましたが、夕方ごろに復旧…
www3.nhk.or.jp
[
「tenki.jp」Web版がつながりにくい状態に 復旧めど立たず またもサイバー攻撃【復旧済み】（ITmedia NEWS） - Yahoo!ニュース
](https://news.yahoo.co.jp/articles/49f62e5dede6cd340d2d06fce608b1a12789a10f)
日本気象協会は1月9日、同日午前7時ごろから、天気予報メディア「tenki.jp」のWeb版にアクセスしづらい状況になっていると発表した。原因はDDoS攻撃という。午前10時24分時点で、復旧のめ

author: Shambhavi Shivani
title: Bank Jobs 2025: 90000 की Salary के लिए झटपट कर लें आवेदन, इस बैंक में निकली जबरदस्त भर्ती
text:
Bank Jobs 2025: यदि आप बैंक की नौकरी करना चाहते हैं तो आपके लिए काम की खबर है. यूनियन बैंक ऑफ इंडिया (Union Bank) ने भर्ती निकाली है. इस भर्ती के लिए समय रहते आवेदन कर दें. यूनियन बैंक ने वेल्थ मैनेजर (स्पेशलिस्ट ऑफिसर) के पदों के लिए भर्तियां निकाली है. उम्मीदवार जो भी इस परीक्षा के लिए अप्लाई करना चाहते हैं, वे यूनियन बैंक की आधिकारिक वेबसाइट पर जाकर आवेदन कर सकते हैं.
Bank Jobs 2025: 250 पदों पर होगी भर्ती आवेदन प्रक्रिया 5 अगस्त से शुरू हो चुकी है. वहीं आवेदन करने की अंतिम तारीख 25 अगस्त 2025 है. समय रहते आवेदन कर लें. देर से आवेदन करने वालों के लिए आवेदन स्वीकार नहीं किए जाएंगे. इस भर्ती के माध्यम से कुल 250 पदों नियुक्ति होगी.
Bank Jobs 2025: आयु सीमा आवेदन करने की न्यूनतम आयु: 25 वर्ष आवेदन करने की अधिकतम आयु: 35 वर्ष आरक्षित वर्गों को सरकारी नियमों के अनुसार आयु में छूट दी जाएगी.
Bank Jobs 2205: योग्यता उम्मीदवार जो कोई भी इन पदों के लिए आवेदन करने की सोच रहे हैं, तो उनके पास किसी भी मान्यता प्राप्त संस्थान और विश्वविद्यालय से MBA, PGDM, PGDBM, PGDBA या इसके समकक्ष डिग्री होनी चाहिए. साथ ही कम से कम 3 वर्ष का संबंधित क्षेत्र में कार्य अनुभव भी होना अनिवार्य है.
Bank Jobs 2025: सैलरी और आवेदन शुल्क आवेदन करने के लिए SC / ST / PwBD उम्मीदवारों को आवेदन शुल्क के तौर पर 177 रुपये का भुगतान करना होगा. वहीं अन्य सभी श्रेणियां के उम्मीदवारों के लिए आवेदन शुल्क 1180 रुपये निर्धारित की गई है. उम्मीदवार का चयन इन पदों के लिए होता है, तो उन्हें सैलरी के तौर पर 64820-2340(1)-67160-2680(10)-93960 रुपये भुगतान किया जाएगा.
यह भी पढ़ें- NIACL AO Result 2025: एनआईएसीएल ने जारी किया रिजल्ट, इस वेबसाइट पर करें चेक

author: Omar El-Sayed
title: 2 women, 7 children, fear of death penalty: secret negotiations for Abu Walaa
text:
Breaking News Abu Walaa Faces Deportation to Iraq as Death Penalty Looms In a significant development in the ongoing saga of the IS terrorist cell in Germany, the German administrative court has ruled in favor of Abu Walaa’s deportation to Iraq. The former leader of IS, sentenced for his role in a deadly terror attack, now faces the chilling possibility of the death penalty upon his arrival in Baghdad.
Court Orders Restrictions on Abu Walaa’s Freedom The Düsseldorf Administrative Court ruling also includes strict conditions for Abu Walaa’s release, including confinement to a specific city and a prohibition on using any communication tools. These measures are in place to curb any potential danger to public security, especially given his prior influence within the IS network. The court emphasizes that these restrictions are necessary to prevent Abu Walaa from orchestrating further terrorist activities while on German soil.
Government Engages in Diplomatic Talks German authorities are engaged in high-level negotiations with Iraqi officials to ensure no danger to life and liberty for Abu Walaa. These discussions are critical as the federal government attempts to secure assurances that he won’t face the death penalty in Baghdad, a move that could potentially complicate his deportation.
Context: The Long and Violent Legacy of Abu Walaa Abu Walaa has been a figure of dread, overseeing a network that attracted young German Muslims to join the IS cause. His terror cell planningis responsible for an attack on a synagogue in Essen, which resulted in injuries. Abu Walaa’s spiritual guidance to his followers made him a threat within and outside prison bars.
Expert analysis suggests that Abu Walaa’s expulsion is part of a broader German effort to crack down on radicalization and terrorism within its borders. This case underscores the complex challenges faced by European countries in balancing security and human rights.
Evergreen Context: The Impact of Deportation on Terrorist Networks
Deporting known terrorists poses a lengthy procedural process involving diplomatic and judicial intricacies. Numerous legal appeals by suspects often delay deportations, with concerns about human rights and international law playing a pivotal role. This situation highlights the ongoing struggles faced by law enforcement agencies in maintaining public safety while adhering to the rule of law.
Call to Action Stay tuned for further developments on this critical issue. Follow archyde.com for the latest updates as this complex and sensitive case unfolds. Your insights and thoughts are valuable; share your opinions and concerns with the wider community.

author: Valley City Times-Record
title: Astir Home Health Care Reinforces Its Dedication to Premier Home Health Care in Bloomfield, NJ | User | times-online.com
text: Bloomfield, NJ - Astir Home Health Care, a leading provider of home health care services, today announced its unwavering commitment to continue offering superior home health care in Bloomfield, NJ. Recognized for its dedication to quality and compassionate care, Astir Home Health Care ensures that families seeking home care in Bloomfield for their loved ones can access the support they need to live comfortably and with dignity in their homes. This ongoing service reflects the company's response to the growing demand for reliable, high-quality home care solutions in the region, emphasizing the importance of personalized care plans and the well-being of each individual. “At Astir Home Health Care, we are deeply committed to the Bloomfield community. Our focus on providing exceptional home health care services is about more than just meeting the basic needs of our clients; it's about enriching their lives and offering peace of mind to their families,” said Cynthia Palmer, owner of Astir Home Health Care. “Our dedication to this mission is stronger than ever as we continue to adapt to the evolving needs of our community, ensuring that every individual and family we serve receives the personalized, compassionate care they deserve.” Astir Home Health Care's approach to home health care is tailored to meet each client's unique needs, ranging from daily living assistance to more complex health care requirements. This personalized approach ensures that every client enjoys a higher quality of life, with services designed to foster independence, provide comfort, and enhance overall well-being. Families in Bloomfield, NJ, looking for top-tier home health care services can rely on Astir Home Health Care for their loved ones' needs. For more information about Astir Home Health Care and their home health care in Bloomfield, NJ , please visit their website at https://astirhc.com About Astir Home Health Care: Astir Home Health Care is a premier provider of home health care services in Bloomfield, NJ. With a reputation for excellence and a team of dedicated health care professionals, Astir Home Health Care offers a comprehensive range of services designed to meet the diverse needs of the elderly community. Committed to enhancing the lives of seniors and their families, Astir Home Health Care remains a leading choice for those seeking quality, compassionate care in the comfort of their own homes. author: Jennifer Yachnin
title: Utah looks to reopen legal battle on national monuments - E&E News by POLITICO
text: BOULDER, Colorado — Utah officials and private citizens aiming to slash millions of acres from a pair of national monuments in their state are pressing to reopen failed federal lawsuits, arguing that that if the two sites expanded by the Biden administration are allowed to stand presidents can claim “effectively limitless” powers to conserve public lands. In arguments Thursday before the 10th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals, Utah Solicitor General Stanford Purser urged a three-judge panel to reinstate a lawsuit filed by state and county officials. An attorney in a case filed by mining interests and an off-road vehicle group likewise asked the court to reopen its case. Both lawsuits center on President Joe Biden’s use of the Antiquities Act of 1906 to expand the boundaries of the Bears Ears and Grand Staircase-Escalante national monuments in 2021, restoring 2 million acres of land removed by former President Donald Trump in 2017 at the behest of Utah lawmakers. Utah Gov. Spencer Cox (R) and county officials allege that Biden exceeded his authority under the 1906 law, which allows presidents to set aside existing public lands to protect areas of scientific, cultural or historic interest. Their argument is that Congress had never intended for the law to be used to create sweeping reserves of public lands.

author: Human Right Watch
title: Bangladesh: Foreign Aid Cuts Affect Rohingya Children's Education | Duurzaamheid
text: Delen via: Bron: Human Right Watch 26 juni 2025, 01:34 United States and other foreign donor cutbacks in humanitarian aid have worsened the already existing education crisis for 437,000 school-age children in Rohingya refugee camps in Bangladesh.
